column4: which version of ubuntu are you running? i have biblatex on my 9.10 box.
You know, I don't actually know. how do I find out?
and i assume "apt-cache search biblatex" turned up nothing?
only two packages which don't do the trick, one seems to contain the latex package but no executable
You said you where uisng biblatex? Then you can confirm there should be an executable too?
no, that's not how i use biblatex. are you sure you're not invoking a script when using it in os x?
actually first time I used it I was doing it manually calling it on each generated auc file manually, (it was a pain) then I found latexmk which now calls it for me
uhm or have I missed soemthing? Was I in fact running bibtex on them?
for comparison, my os x box doesn't have a biblatex command either, and i'm running TeXLive 2009.
yea I just realised that too, jonalv takes a step back. He was wrong. But then, why does his bibliography turn up on his mac and not on his Ubuntu machine?
thanks for your help, I ran bibtex manually and now it works, I wonder if there was some sort of bug in latexmk that bit me...
